intro: Discocalyx minor var. minor, commonly known as the small-flowered discocalyx, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, branched stems and finely divided, pinnate leaves. Its small white flowers are arranged in dense, spherical clusters, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. It is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal and medicinal properties.
